div.text:p: There are a number of interesting challenges here:

text:list-item.text:p: How to make a customised export based on styles in Writer.
This is specific to Writer, and at this stage of the game it's a moving target.
How to map styles to nicely nested XHTML.
This is a perennial topic; while there are word processors with their own idea about structure, which is largely flat.

utfx:expected.p: There are a number of interesting challenges here:

li.p: How to make a customised export based on styles in Writer.
This is specific to Writer, and at this stage of the game it's a moving target.
How to map styles to nicely nested XHTML.
This is a perennial topic; while there are word processors with their own idea about structure, which is largely flat.

utfx:test.utfx:name: Fancy Definition list with embedded list level 1

utfx:source.text:p: Fancy Definition lists with embedded list following dt
Definition goes here am porta tincidunt felis.

utfx:expected.p: Fancy Definition lists with embedded list following dt

dl.dd: Definition goes here am porta tincidunt felis.

dl.dd: Definition goes here am porta tincidunt felis.

utfx:source.text:p: Definition goes here am porta tincidunt felis.

utfx:test.utfx:name: more complicated multi-level numbering with paras

utfx:source.text:p: Topic Two Point One Not Numbered
Topic Two Point Two Not Numbered
Sub-Topic Three Point Two Point One
Sub-Topic Three Point Two Point Two
Idea Three Point Two Point Two Point One
Sub-Topic Three Point Two Point Three

utfx:expected.h2: Topic Two Point One Not Numbered
Topic Two Point Two Not Numbered
utfx:expected.h3: 4.2.1 Sub-Topic Three Point Two Point One
4.2.2 Sub-Topic Three Point Two Point Two
utfx:expected.h4: 4.2.2.1 Idea Three Point Two Point Two Point One
utfx:expected.h3: 4.2.3 Sub-Topic Three Point Two Point Three
